channel.title: BBC News - Wales

item.title: Church in Wales to vote on blessings for same-sex marriages
item.description: Even if the move is approved, the Church in Wales will still not marry same-sex couples.

item.title: Stereophonics and Sir Tom Jones to play festive Cardiff show
item.description: The rockers will be joined by Sir Tom Jones and Catfish And The Bottlemen in all-Welsh concert.

item.title: Cardiffâ€™s Castle Street: Work to begin for return of cars
item.description: The council says the closure has increased pollution nearby but green groups want it to stay closed.

item.title: Five people seriously injured in two car crash in Gwynedd
item.description: The crash happened north of Rhydymain near Dolgellau on Sunday afternoon.

item.title: City Road: Five taken to hospital after reports of assault in Cardiff
item.description: The ambulance service says it sent its hazardous area response team to the scene.

item.title: Covid: Ceredigion towns' roads reopen as extra space scheme ends
item.description: Roads which closed to give extra space to pedestrians and businesses in Ceredigion are reopened.

item.title: Borth fire: No-one injured but animals killed
item.description: Neighbouring properties were evacuated and a major incident was declared.

item.title: Millions of pupils return to school amid Covid spike concern
item.description: Schools open their classrooms to millions of pupils in England and Wales with hopes and fears.

item.title: Blaenavon fire: Crews tackle large blaze at recycling plant
item.description: Residents in the area were told to keep doors and windows shut due to a large smoke plume.

item.title: Belarus 2-3 Wales: Gareth Bale scores hat-trick in World Cup qualifier
item.description: Gareth Bale scores a match-winning hat-trick to save Wales from embarrassment against Belarus and keep alive their hopes of qualifying for the World Cup.

item.title: Sexism in the workplace: Women scared to speak out in NHS
item.description: A recent report found about 91% of female doctors in the UK had experienced sexism at work.

item.title: Tom Hardy: Can a star's posts give locations a tourism boost?
item.description: Tom Hardy, Lin-Manuel Miranda and Forest Whitaker have all been seen enjoying Wales while filming.

item.title: Firefighters tackle large Blaenavon recycling plant blaze
item.description: Residents living nearby have been advised to keep windows and doors closed due to smoke.

item.title: Covid, Brexit and driver shortage blamed for bin collection delays
item.description: Some residents are complaining that rubbish has been left on their streets for weeks.

item.title: Borth fire: Flames and black smoke billow from blaze
item.description: The fire broke out in a three-storey property with 30 firefighters trying to stop it spreading.

item.title: Tokyo Olympians welcomed home to Ystrad Mynach and Blackwood
item.description: Boxing gold medallist Lauren Price said it was "amazing" to give back to their home towns.

item.title: Covid: Diary records how pandemic changed care home life
item.description: A former journalist writes a diary of his experiences during lockdown, including being in hospital.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: 15-year-old Cardiff sprinter with big dreams
item.description: Sprinter Tomi Roberts-Jones has cerebral palsy and, aged 15, has already represented Wales.

item.title: Gareth Bale summons spirit of Andorra and Euro 2016 to save Wales against Belarus
item.description: Gareth Bale summons the spirit of Andorra and Euro 2016 to save Wales once again against Belarus.

item.title: Gerwyn Price: World number one wins Hungarian Darts Trophy
item.description: Wales' Gerwyn Price has won his fourth PDC European Tour title with victory in the inaugural Hungarian Darts Trophy.

item.title: Tanni Grey-Thompson column: 'Great moments in Tokyo but Para-sport faces challenges'
item.description: Baroness Tanni Grey-Thompson reflects on Great Britain's performance at the Tokyo Paralympics and what comes next for Para-sport.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics and Paralympics: How the Welsh athletes did at Tokyo 2020
item.description: BBC Sport Wales looks back at the Welsh medal winners at the Tokyo Olympic and Paralympic Games

item.title: County Championship: Durham seamers outclass Glamorgan
item.description: Durham bowl Glamorgan out for just 97 with their seamers running riot, before reaching 223-3 on a one-sided first day.

item.title: Hiliaeth: Arolwg yn awgrymu fod Cymru'n 'wlad ranedig'
item.description: Ymgyrchwyr gwrth-hiliaeth yn pryderu y bydd mwy o anghydraddoldeb yn sgil effaith economaidd y pandemig.

item.title: Ailagor ffyrdd parthau diogel trefi Ceredigion
item.description: Cafodd ffyrdd mewn pedair tref eu cau fel bod siopwyr ac ymwelwyr yn gallu cadw pellter cymdeithasol.

item.title: Stryd y Castell: Dechrau'r gwaith i geir dychwelyd
item.description: Mae grwpiau amgylcheddol yn galw ar y cyngor sir i gadw'r stryd ynghau i geir preifat i leihau llygredd.

item.title: Asado: Dod Ã¢'r arfer Archentaidd o goginio cig i Gaernarfon
item.description: Yr Archentwr a'r canwr Billy Hughes sydd wedi dysgu'r cofi o Gaernarfon, Michael Downey sut i wneud Asado.

item.title: Bowlwyr Durham yn cael y gorau ar Forgannwg
item.description: Morgannwg dan bwysau mawr ar ddiwedd diwrnod cyntaf y gÃªm ym Mhencampwriaeth y Siroedd.
